name: Hotel More

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, but a shuttle would be nice
reviews.text: Hotel More is a beautiful hotel with amazing views and very friendly and helpful staff. We were given a room with a breathtaking view on the 1st floor for our honeymoon. It was a very nice touch to have a big white bow on the door and a bottle of very good champagne with a personal note in the room. Our view was so nice we didn't leave the room except for dinner for our first day! Our room had a jacuzzi tub, which was nice, although there was no way of turning the jets off from the tub; the switch was next to the light switch just outside of the bathroom, which I thought was strange. The hotel also has a hot tub outside, which I prefer, but when I went one night it was emptied.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was nice and the shower was just great with good water pressure and hot water. The towels were also nice and fluffy and a good size, a rarity in many hotels. Unfortunately, this hotel suffers from making the same assumptions as other hotels and never left us an adequate number of towels, so every night we had to call for extra towels. One big problem with the bathroom, though, was the lighting. There is no lighting over the mirror, and the overall lighting is pretty dismal. The fan in the bathroom also seemed to turn itself on randomly. The toiletries were abundant, but pretty low quality. I was very thankful to have my own.
reviews.title: Room with a view?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room also came with robes and slippers, and the slippers came in very handy on the 12-hour flight home! The hotel also provides a local cell phone--a nice touch! The cave bar is also very cool and we had a drink there one night.
reviews.title: Room with a view - essential
Beautiful Hotel in a great location with brilliant staff.
reviews.text: The breakfast was OK, although the only tea they had was the equivalent of a lipton tea bag (no green tea) and they seem to put the tea bag in far in advance so by the time I got my tea it was very bitter. We did try the restaurant for dinner on our first night was were sadly disappointed. The restaurant is insanely expensive (as well as everything else in Dubrovnik--be warned), and the food was pretty mediocre. I'm always most excited about dessert, and couldn't wait to try the local creme caramel specialty. But it was awful. It was way too eggey. I think it was only the second time in my life where I didn't finish my dessert.

My main complaints were the beds and the location. The king bed was actually two twin beds pushed together and separately made--separate sheets, separate twin-size blankets, etc. Considering we were on our honeymoon, this made snuggling pretty difficult. The location is great for the sea views, but quite a distance away from Old City and not very easy to get to. The hotel told us to wait for the #5 bus down the road and that the bus came every 20 minutes or so. We waited and waited and waited. After wasting about 45 minutes waiting for the bus, the staff from the hotel behind the bus stop told us that the bus was not running on that route anymore. I was so frustrated with wasting so much time we just grabbed the taxi that was dropping someone off there. Considering the distance, a shuttle between the hotel and Old City would be a great touch. We were also unaware of a great promenade with lots of restaurants just steps from our hotel on the beach side (and by beach, I don't mean beach--there is no real beach at the hotel itself). No one at the front desk mentioned this and we found it accidentally. But we were glad we did find it as we had one of our best meals at Konavoka just down the street!
reviews.title: perfect location,lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel More for nine days in September, not by chance, we had done our homework and specifically requested fourth floor with a sea view - which we duly got. A most beautiful view, high across the bay of Lapad, and various islands, lighthouses, the odd seagull and all that sort of sea stuff. The hotel is located the right way round so you see the sunset from your balcony, nice chairs and table for an evening stiffener and a fag. We have done all the usual places and needed a change, and thought we'd give Dubrovnik a go, somewhere different. Firstly I must say breakfast was excellent, with a very wide choice for both English and east European/Balkan tastes, Coffee was a bit thin.
reviews.title: Beautiful sea view!
Lovely hotel with great swimming
reviews.text: The staff were first class, friendly and helpful, apart from the front desk who were pretty stony and negative.

The room was well equipped and with excellent air conditioning, good bathroom marble effect and all the goodies. The bed was very good indeed. We mostly had dinner in the hotel. They have a broad A la Carte menu, using the freshest ingredients. Their cooking is of the highest order, matching or bettering many top-drawer English establishments we have stayed in.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Access to town is by the No 6 bus which runs every few minutes, 24Kn for two on the bus or 20Kn from the adjacent ticket offices. The walk to the bus stop is easy and pleasantly downhill, or you can use the coast trail as you prefer. A good schedule we found was to do the beach bit in the morning, bus to town for a late lunch (there are hundreds of restaurants and bistros) espresso somewhere else and get in some solid legwork doing the Old Town over. History,you can read all this up for yourself, but ponder over just why on earth anyone in their right mind, twenty years ago now, would want to shell and smash up such an ancient and beautiful place. As tourists we well made very welcome everywhere we went. We can most warmly recommend the Hotel More and Dubrovnik to future travellers.
reviews.title: very nice hote

reviews.text: We stayed overnight at Hotel More on our honeymoon. It is not far from the Old City on a penisula nearby - which is actually a benefit because we found the main city a bit touristy
reviews.title: A wonderful view over the bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third hotel of our stay in Croatia and Montenegro.We had originally booked a sea view room but decided to upgrade to a junior suite, room 404 specifically, and received an email from one of the managers Robert Trpin confirming the room was available for our dates.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: When we arrived around 2pm we were given all the information regarding the hotel by the receptionist and then she told us that they had no room available for for the first night.We had booked this hotel weeks in advance and also had the confirmation from the manager with us. We asked to see him but were told that he wasn't there.
reviews.title: Perfect for peacefull rest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needless to say we were not happy. They said that for that night we were to go to one of their appartments instead...Just aswell we had a car as we then followed one of the staff to look at the appartment in question.
reviews.title: New find - Keep it under your hat sssh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At this point I must mention that another reviewer on Tripadvisor had said that they were double booked at this hotel and moved to the appartments also. This reviewer however was delighted, so they say, to be there and decided not to go back to the hotel but stay where they were. All I will say is that we were there for approx. 5- 10 minutes before heading back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Top Class Hotel

reviews.text: If you would prefer to stay somewhere claustrophic, even though there was plenty of space with lots of wood, small windows overlooking a superemarket,no working telephone and a dingy bathroom and not a glimpse of the sea.....it could be for you. The swimming pool that they mentioned was circular with some sort of a pillar in the middle,hence only about 3 or4 foot wide. It reminded us of what they use for horses that are recovering from injury ! Last but not least the attractive man in the string vest sitting outside.
reviews.title: Faultless gem away from the crowds.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel More (pronounced as "More-Re") in late October 2011 for 3 nights. Dubrovnik is a lovely town with a beautiful walled old town and fast developing (though less pretty) new areas. Situated just by the Adriatic Sea, the scenery is lovely and relaxing. However, the hordes of tourists sometimes makes it a bit difficult to appreciate the beauty of this small city.
reviews.title: One of the better hotels in Dubrovnik but a little out of the way and needs some improvement ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel More is situated in an area that is more residential and it takes a 15-20 minute bus ride to the main old town area (a UNESCO Heritage site and a must-see). The hotel itself is relatively modern but could do with some upgrading, in particular, Wifi access in the rooms, better flat screen TVs and firmer beds. Other than that, the premises and housekeeping are generally what you might expect of a typical 4 star hotel. The restaurant food is pretty average so if I were you, I'd hop on a bus and go to the old town for a better (and cheaper) selection of food there.
reviews.title: Brilliant! If you are in Dubrovnik - you should stay here!

reviews.text: The pool is very small though and many of the rooms do not have a sea view, so if you are fussy about that, do make sure you reserve the correct room / suite in advance and have it documented.
reviews.title: Awesome stay

reviews.text: The hotel does provide transport (at a fee) between the facility and the airport (which is very helpful).
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - in the most perfect spot!

reviews.text: What a great combination! Great customer service and great facilities! From the very first had a "homely" feeling with a high level of comfort. My highest level of recommendation is that we had planned to use the hotel as a base for exploring the Dubrovnik region - and it is great for that - but The More was so welcoming, relaxing and comfortable (and wonderful views) that we spent virtually all our time there!
reviews.title: Best ever

reviews.text: As we planed our vacation on Croatia coast we looked at tripadvisor and saw hotel More with great recomendations. They were all true. On the perfect place, very quiet hotel best to injoy your vacation.
reviews.title: Hotel for best vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderfull restorant with great terrace, and unique cave bar.
reviews.title: Unique, sweet place

reviews.text: We had a great dinner in a cosy, nice arranged restaurant in this excellent hotel. Staff is well-trained and pay attention to every detail, nice individuals on the bar/in restaurant/reception, very friendly and helpful. Nice ginger-steak and great dark-beer. Perfect see-view, you can almost jump from the room balcony/terrace of restaurant into the see. We really enjoyed it and look forward to our next visit/dinner.
reviews.title: Great stay in a fantastic hotel
Agent's recommendation spot on
reviews.text: I recently stayed in Hotel More with 3 friends and we had a wonderful stay. We booked our holiday with travelrepublic.co.uk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in Lapad around 10 mins drive from Dubrovnik City and 30 mins from the airport. The hotel is located in a great spot with excellent views of Lapad and the bay. We ordered our transfer with the hotel. it cost around the same as a normal taxi at the airport (around £25). It was nice to be greeted by hotel staff.
reviews.title: Awesome
Excellent
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, we were lucky enough to be upgraded to one of the new suite / apartments. This was amazing with a jacuzzi on our massive terrace, a bedroom and living room, and an incredible sea view. The accommodation was some of the best we have stayed in.

The staff are very helpful and all speak perfect English. Food is good and the restaurant is very reasonably priced, the "beefsteak" is delicious. The cave bar is amazing, it's built into a cave under the hotel with an entrance that leads to the terrace by the sea.
reviews.title: Great hotel in dubrovnik

reviews.text: The hotel is very well placed for travel to the old town, there are busses a few minutes away which take about 20 minutes or you can walk in less than an hour. Near the hotel, abiut a 10 minute walk along the edge of the sea, are a large number of bars and restaurants which all looked good, we were too tired to get further than the hotel restaurant or spectacular cave bar though!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, very unique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful vistas, nice staff, hot tub on balcony. We stayed three nights here and loved it. Cave bar was fun, sea side nice and ate dinner here two nights. Breakfasts are sumptuous.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel but maybe eat dinner elsewhere

reviews.text: Would return in a heartbeat. Easy to get to old town via buses. Nice reprieve from hustle bustle of old town
reviews.title: UNIQUE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from staying a week at the More Hotel and can only repeat what the vast majority of fellow reviewers have already said.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Dubrovnik!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is spotlessly clean, the staff very friendly and enormously helpful. Any request is met with a willingness to help and always a smile.
reviews.title: Flawed Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of options at Breakfast (including sparkling wine!).
reviews.title: A fantasitic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plenty of different areas to relax and enjoy the sun and a drink at any time.
reviews.title: Best boutique hotel for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It combines luxury whilst still providing a very personal level of service, something many high standard larger hotels fail to do.
reviews.title: We'll be going back for 'More'

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in the old town before moving out to Lapad and booked into The More Hotel.
reviews.title: Simply superb!

reviews.text: We were fortunate to stay in a suit (room 601). The room was amazing but was eclipsed by the service we received. In particular, Nicolina and Mrs Irida, made us feel so welcome at 'at home'. Our stay would not have been the same same without their touch.
reviews.title: A jewl in the crown of Dubrovnik

reviews.text: The More Hotel is small but perfectly formed. The rear is south west facing so there are spectacular sun sets. The cave bar is quaint but we thought it looked better in the photos that in real life.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!
Great hotel, some big watch outs though
reviews.text: The restaurant is good but the menu becomes a bit restrictive after a few days stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had visited other hotels, Excelsior etc before booking the hotel More and I can assure you that this Hotel was far superior the those with much higher rankings. The other all seemed far more corporate and had less soul than the Hotel More.
reviews.title: Go here for 'small', 'quiet', location' but not for '5 star' or 'food'

description: Hotel More is an exclusive five-star boutique hotel situated in the Bay of Lapad, one of the most beautiful locations on the area of the City of Dubrovnik. The hotel view of calming green pines, of Mediterranean vegetation abundant with colors and scents, of the glaring azure sea, of rocky cliffs - those eternal stone guards and memorable sunsets, will astonish any traveler and guest.
